On Thu, May 29, 2008 at 8:12 AM, martin_erlandsson <marterland@...> wrote:
> Hi JUnit:ers!
>
> The simplest way of checking that no tests in a suite depend on network
> access is of course to simply pull the network cord and see which tests
> fail. (Or disabling the network card if you don't want to leave your
> keyboard...)
>
> But how do I make sure that no tests depend on anything else outside
> the JVM? I am looking for a simple and full-proof way to disallow file
> system access, registry access and the like. (No need for fancy
> programmatic approaches, manual steps are fine.)
>
> Any ideas? Thanks.
>
> /Martin
>
>
